title: Rugby World Cup: flying start for Wales in 43-14 win over Georgia – video highlights
text: Wales's World Cup journey got off to a flying start in a 43-14 win over Georgia at Toyota City Stadium. Warren Gatland's men ran in four tries to lead Georgia 29-0 and claim a bonus point by half-time. But Georgia hit back with two tries of their own after the break, drawing the second half 14-14. Wales scored six tries in total to mark captain Alun Wyn Jones' 129th cap, as he equalled Gethin Jenkins' appearance record. Grand slam champions Wales will now prepare for the crucial Pool D meeting with Australia on Sunday 29 September in Tokyo.
description: A four-try first-half blitz from Wales ensured victory over Georgia at City of Toyota Stadium
